page.title: 03AROUND EVERCREECH
page.content:
MILTON CLEVEDON
Milton Clevedon did have a population of over 500 but now it has shrunk to 81! There used to be a voluntary controlled school which is now a private house. There is a pub in Milton Clevedon. People come to this from quite a way around. About half a mile from the centre of Milton Clevedon is a Maggot Farm producing bait for fishermen.
WESTCOMBE AND BATCOMBE
Westcombe and nearby Batcombe are small spread out villages.There is only one shop,the Post Office.There are several large farms and a dairy where Cheddar Cheese is made.The church is very similar to Evercreech but without pinnacles on the tower.
